body.p: The probabilities in this table were calculated from data describing the highest level of educational attainment in 2005 for U.S. adults 25 years old or older. (Source: U.S. Census Bureau, Current Population Survey, March 2005)

image.alt: table of probability of highest level of education attained

body.p: What is the probability that a randomly selected U.S. adult in this age category has not graduated from high school?

multiple_choice.choice: It is impossible to tell since the events “no high school” and “some high school” are not disjoint.

response.feedback: Incorrect. 0.085 is the probability that a randomly selected adult attended high school but did not graduate. The event “has not graduated from high school” is composed of two outcomes from the table.

Correct. P(has not graduated from high school) = P(“no high school” or “some high school”) = 0.063 + 0.085 = 0.148. We can add these probabilities since the events “no high school” and “some high school” are disjoint. These events are disjoint because the table describes the highest level of educational attainment for an individual.
